page.title: 08The Yealmpton Branch Railway
page.content: The Yealmpton Railway was opened in January 1898 by Lady Morley.It started at Plymouth Friary and ended at Yealmpton, a total distance of six miles east.Towards its end it ran along the banks of the River Yealm, just outside our block. The planned terminus at Modbury was never reached, and so the track terminated just past Yealmpton in thick woods. The stations in order from Plymouth Friary were: Plymstock, Billacombe, Elburton, Brixton Road, Steer Point & Yealmpton. The line was worked as a passenger service for 38 years. In its early life the line carried Elburton produce to the market, such as milk,cream,and local vegetables and during the early 1900's large amounts of the famous home-grown tomatoes. The Branch was finally shut down on 28th August 1960 after 62 years of service.
